text: Nautilus cookanum is an extinct species of nautilus. It lived during the Eocene epoch. N. cookanum placed within the genus Nautilus, together with extant species based on their shared shell characters.Ward, P.D. & W.B. Saunders 1997. Allonautilus: a new genus of living nautiloid cephalopod and its bearing on phylogeny of the Nautilida. Journal of Paleontology 71(6): 1054–1064. Fossils of the species from the Late Eocene Hoko River Formation are noted as one of the two oldest occurrences for the genus. ==References== Category:Prehistoric nautiloids Category:Nautiluses Category:Eocene molluscs Category:Eocene animals of North America Category:Fossil taxa described in 1892
title: Nautilus cookanum
